In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code to solve this problem:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> year(x)*100 + month(x), df.dt)
    return df
end
```
This function takes a DataFrame `df` as input and adds a new column `ym`. The values in this new column are calculated by mapping over the `dt` column, extracting the year and month from each DateTime value using the `year` and `month` functions, respectively. These two values are then concatenated together into an integer format "yyyymm".

Here is how you can use it:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt=DateTime[now()-Month(i) for i in 1:5]) # create a sample dataframe with DateTime column
add_yearmonth(df) # add the new ym column
```
